status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [Python] "Could NOT find Arrow": Installing "pyarrow" via pip3 on Debian 10

comments.body: Could you upgrade your pip and try again?

We dropped support for manylinux1.
And pip added support for manylinux2010 since 19.0: https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/news/#v19-0
And Debian GNU/Linux buster ships pip 18.1.
pip < 19.0 uses source archive instead of wheel. Pip with source archive is also supported installation.

Do you have any idea to improve your situation? If you have, could you open a pull request?

Sorry I am not an expert here. I had to ask Wikipedia to know what "manylinux" is.

In the news I read about that pip switched from sources to wheel. But I am not deep enough into that topic to know about the konsequences.

I have no idea what the problem is or how this could be handled in the Debian context. I would suggest to contact the Debian people at their python-mailinglist or open a ticket about the "python3-pyarrow" package.
[~jorisvandenbossche] [~amol-] We may want to find a way to warn users from our {{setup.py}} when pip is trying to install from source by mistake.
